data.title: SiVa ACCESS
data.meta_description: Resources Where Ideas Flourish Our leadership team has a proven track record and transformative impact on growth and success at HP, Sun, SAP, Intel, Nvidia, SanDisk/Western Digital, Ansys, Qualcomm, National, Marvell and technology startups worldwide Innovations and Granted Patents Excellence in Cloud Computing Author: Prakash Narayan, et al ( Co-founder and Managing Partner )Patent Disclosures1.
data.text:
1. US Patent # 8952736: “Method and system for quantization-free and Fractional-N Generation for Phase-Locked Loops”, assigned to Nvidia on 02/10/2015.

2. US Patent # 7371005: “Automatic Circuit and Method for Temperature Compensation of Oscillator frequency Variation over temperature for a Real Time Clock Chip”, assigned to Intersil Corporation on 05/13/2008.

3. US Patent # 7038720: “A Pixel by Pixel Digital Control of Gain/Offset Correction for Video Imaging”, assigned to Exar Corp. on 05/02/2006.

4. US Patent # 7221209: “Precision Floating Gate Reference Temperature Coefficient Compensation Circuit and Method”, assigned to Intersil Corporation on 05/22/2007.

5. US Patent # 7078958 :“A CMOS Bandgap Reference with low voltage operation”, assigned to Exar Corp. on 7/18/2006.

6. US Patent #6952240: “Image sampling circuit with a blank reference combined with the video input”, assigned to Exar Corp. on 10/4/2005.

7. US Patent #6573784: :“Low Power Wide Bandwidth Programmable Gain CDS/IA”, assigned to Exar Corp. on 6/3/2003.

8. US Patent #6462695: “Dynamic Biasing Techniques for Low Power Pipeline ADC”, assigned to Exar Corp. on 10/08/2002.

9. US Patent # 6246283: “Power Efficient Line Driver”, assigned to Tripath Corp. on 6/12/2001.

10. US Patent # 6281747: “Power Efficient Line Driver”, assigned to Tripath Corp. on 8/28/2001.

11. US Patent # 5886657: “Selectable Reference Voltage Circuit for DAC”, assigned to C-Cube Microsystems on 6/23/1999.

12. US Patent # 5909187: “Current Steering DAC”, assigned to C-Cube Microsystems on 6/1/1999.

13. US Patent # 5586306: “Integrated Circuit Servo System for Disk Drive”, assigned to Cirrus Logic on 12/17/1996.

14. US Patent # 5398262: “Clock Skew Free Generation Techniques”, assigned to Intel Corp on 3/14/1995.

15. US Patent # 5307381: “Clock Skew Free Distribution Techniques”, assigned to Intel Corp on 4/26/1994.

16. US Patent # 5021684: “Process, Supply, Temperature Compensating Buffer”, assigned to Intel Corp on 6/4/1991.

17. US Patent # 4442529: “Power Supply Rejection Characteristics of CMOS Circuits”, assigned to AT&T Bell Labs on 4/10/1984.
